context: In Estonian, 'õudne' is an adjective that means terrible, awful, dreadful, or horrifying. It can describe something that causes fear, dread, or extreme unpleasantness. The word derives from 'õudus' (horror) and can be used to modify nouns referring to frightening experiences, scary places, or extremely negative situations. In some contexts, it can also mean very unpleasant or severe in intensity.
